verses.verse: A wise son hears his father's instruction, but a scorner does not hear rebuke.
From the fruit of his mouth a man eats good, but the soul of those betraying eats violence.
He who guards his mouth keeps his life; he who opens his lips wide, ruin is to him.
A sluggish one's soul is craving, but having nothing, but the soul of the diligent ones shall be made fat.
The righteous one hates a word of falsehood, but the wicked one is odious and acts shamefully.
Righteousness keeps the way of the one of integrity, but wickedness subverts a sin-offering.
There is one being rich, yet having nothing at all; but one acting poor has much wealth.
The ransom of a man's life is his riches, but one acting poor does not hear rebuke.
The light of the righteous ones rejoice, but the lamp of the wicked ones shall be put out.
Only by pride comes strife, but with those taking counsel wisdom.
Wealth from vanity shall diminish, but he who gathers by hand shall increase.
Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a tree of life is desire coming.
He who despises the Word shall ruin himself, but one fearing the commandment, he shall be rewarded.
The law of the wise one is a fountain of life, to turn away from the snares of death.
Good prudence gives grace, but the way of those betraying is ever flowing.
Every prudent one deals with knowledge, but a fool lays open his folly.
A wicked messenger falls into an evil way, but a faithful envoy is healing.
Poverty and shame shall be to him letting chastening go, but he who keeps to chastisement shall be honored.
The desire coming to pass is sweet to the soul, but to turn away from an evil way is a disgusting thing to fools.
One walking with the wise ones shall be wise, but a feeder of fools shall be made evil.
An evil end pursues sinners, but the righteous ones shall be rewarded with good.
A good man makes the sons of his son to inherit, but the wealth of the sinner is treasured up for the righteous one .
The tilled land of one being poor yields much food, but when there is no justice, it is swept away.
One holding back his rod is hating his son, but he loving him seeks him with correction.
The righteous one eats to the satisfaction of his soul, but the belly of the wicked ones shall lack.
